meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the absence of genetic material.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the agenetic cells to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent2: The agenetic condition in the experiment led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent3: The agenetic mice in the lab were quite the mystery to the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her agenetic approach to the problem allowed for a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The barren land seemed agenetic, devoid of any life or growth.

meanings.definition: A person or organism lacking genetic material.
meanings.sent1: The agenetic was a subject of fascination for geneticists worldwide.
meanings.sent2: The scientist discovered a new species of agenetic in the deep sea.
meanings.sent3: The agenetic in the zoo was a hit with visitors due to its uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: The agenetic in the story symbolized the idea of starting anew.
meanings.sent5: The agenetic stood out in the crowd, a rare sight to behold.
